body:
r? @nikomatsakis

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)

OK, I've taken a review pass and this looks basically good to me. There's a lot of detail work -- adding documentation, cleanup, etc -- but I think the core functionality is in reasonable shape to land. Thanks @Kimundi!
I mostly only looked over the API instead of the implementation itself (looks like @aturon and @huonw have you covered there), and it looks great to me. Nice work @Kimundi!

Most of the comments should be addressed now.

A few things I noticed myself:
- Do we want to keep the impl of `Pattern` for `&[char]`? Now that arbitrary string representations can be patterns, the semantic of `&[char]` might be ambiguous. Its the same as using `|c| slice.contains(c)` as a pattern right now, but might be mistaken or better be defined as the equivalent of `slice.collect::<String>()` instead.
- Some of the iterator adapters don't implement Clone anymore due to a associated types bug that got fixed in the meantime.

I'm pretty happy with this, I'd be willing to merge but I think @aturon should sign off as well.

> Do we want to keep the impl of Pattern for &[char]?

I'd be fine dropping it.

> Some of the iterator adapters don't implement Clone anymore due to a associated types bug that got fixed in the meantime.

That should be fine, I don't think it's _too_ common and we can always add later!

@bors: r+ 7fa2fdf

I talked with @aturon on IRC and he's in favor.
Hm, those failures seem unrelated to the PR?
Unless that timeout error is because of the slower string search...
:hourglass: Testing commit c8dd2d0 with merge cf04813...
:hourglass: Testing commit c8dd2d0 with merge e4fff79...

```
---- [pretty] run-pass/cci_capture_clause.rs stdout ----

error: pretty-printed source does not typecheck
status: exit code: 101
command: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage2/bin/rustc - -Zno-trans --crate-type=lib --target=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -L x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/test/run-pass -L x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/test/run-pass/cci_capture_clause.stage2-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnulibaux --cfg rtopt --cfg debug -O -L x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rt
```

Could you see if `make check-stage1-rpass-pretty TESTNAME=cci_capture_clause` passes locally (might be `pretty-rpass`), and if there's an easy way to fix the error? (Otherwise we might have to `ignore-pretty` the test)

`make check-stage2-pretty-rpass TESTNAME=cci_capture_clause` passes locally.

(The `stage1` one gives me staging compilation errors about Hash not having enough arguments in libtest.)
